snippet: The Wisconsin vote pitting Gov. Scott Walker against Tom Barrett will send a message about Americans’ attitudes toward candidates who cut collective bargaining rights.
abstract: Gov Scott Walker’s campaign to survive a recall vote in Wisconsin against Democrat Tom Barrett has the feel, the money and the stakes of a national race; outcome will not just decide the state’s leanings on matters of budget, taxes and policy, it will also send a message about a larger fight over labor across the country, and about whether voters are likely to reject those who cut collective bargaining rights, as Walker did last year for most of the state’s public workers, setting off the recall.
lead_paragraph: The Wisconsin vote pitting Gov. Scott Walker against Tom Barrett will send a message about Americans’ attitudes toward candidates who cut collective bargaining rights.

headline.seo: Wisconsin Recall Vote Could Foretell November Election
headline.main: Recall Election Could Foretell November Vote
headline.print_headline: Recall Election Could Foretell November Vote
